text: From 33 bottle. Pours rather pale yellow with irregular white foam. Aroma is of tropical fruits, but also citrus. Body is light. Taste is moderately bitter. Finish is nice and short.

On tap @BQ Navigli (Milan). Giallo paglierino, leggermente torbida, schiuma media bianca, buona persistenza. Al naso fantastici sentori di frutta, uva, lime, passionfruit, molto fresca! In bocca è equilibrata e gradevolissima, base di malto leggera con finale amaro morbido, fruttato e fresco. Corpo medio-leggero, carbonazione corretta. Birra splendida, bevuta freschissima!

Bottle 0,33. Pours clear golden with medium white head. Aroma of citrus, pine, apricot, hops, hay. Taste is grape, hops, floral, withe nice bitterness in the aftertaste. Medium body and fizzy carbonation.

Bottle at Bobs Brewery. Clear pale yellow, medium sized diminishing white head. Citrus driven nose, light flowers and white bread too. Peach, apricot. Light body, lively and somewhat fizzy carbonation. Citrus, peach, apricot and hay. Light sweet and bitter with a long hoppy finish. Easy drinking.
33 cl. bottle. Hazy yellow colour with a white head. Aroma and flavour of citrus, hops, pine, peach and a bitter finish.
En meget humlet øl, der er meget blomster og frugt i smagen, en rigtig god øl.
Il colore è tendente al rosso, con una opacità abbastanza pronunciata. Laroma e fruttato, agrumi e miele con note citriche. il suo sapore è molto luppolato, piacevolmente secco. Ben fatta

Bottle 0.33l Taste sample at the Toccalmatto brewery Fidenza Italy. Thank you Grande Bruno for fantastic day and experience.05.12.2015.Great beer tour guys ippopotamo36, Boban.Pour it orange color with medium white head.Aroma fresh squeesed orange.Taste juicy, sweet tropical fruits,malts present gentle finish.Perfect balanced again.Bravo
Cítrica y tropical. De color limón pálido algo nublada. Fondo amargo, con poco cuerpo y muy refrescante. Muy veraniega.

Dorata pallida, velata dai lieviti, schiuma bianca poco persistente.
Aroma di pompelmo, uva bianca, limone e ananas, crosta di pane, pepe, scorza di limone, zucchero candito, nota pungente sempre di pepe, leggero erbaceo rustico.
Al palato pompelmo e ananas, leggero kiwi, successivamente scorza di limone, crosta di pane che persistono anche nella sua coda mista a leggero pompelmo, erbaceo e pepe.
Corpo leggero, ben carbonata, leggermente watery.
On tap at Biercab. Clear golden colour with white head. MAlt, hoppy and floral aroma. Malt, grain, hoppy and floral taste. Medium body.

giallo chiaro con schiuma bianca non particolarmente persistente. bollicine in libertà, la birra è limpida e piacevole da vedere, anche se la schiuma così poco presente non la rende perfetta. Al palato è un avventura, profumo intenso e nitido, anche abbastanza vario. Dal Kiwi e anans iniziali, si passa subito alle note di ago di pino, scorza dagrumi, uva spina e melone retato. Bellissimo bouquet di odori, magari non il massimo della persistenza ma sulla varietà e sulla pulizia cè da togliersi il cappello e rimanere ad occhi chiusi ad immaginare un insieme spaziale di frutta, fresca e buona per la bella stagione. In bocca ha una leggerà acidità iniziale, data dalla componente agrumata. pompelmo rosa, direi. Anche luva acerba, luva spina, risaltano. Amaro presente, dato dalla scorza dagrumi, con un passaggio blando e calcolato dalliniziale sapore di pompelmo al complesso duva e la leggerissima nota fruttata. Amare, si congeda secca, molto secca. Il ritorno è di uva dolce, nel retrogusto, per una birra complessa nonostante il tenore alcolico contenuto. In bocca è leggera, ma non acquosa. Sempre bene legata, coerente, ha una carbonatazione media, percettibile ma che non disturba mai la bevuta. In definitiva unottima birra, di quelle che si lasciano bere con molto, molto piacere.
On tap.Nice hazy Light Yellow color. Expected a lot of hop flavor but they didnt arrived. A little bit watering. Not an impressive beer.

Pours really classical golden, bit of white foam but not much of it. Aroma is very hoppy, even fruity - but dry. Nelson is coming through and contributes to "full" fruity character this beer has. Taste is hoppy, light, and fully enjoyable. This could be called also a session IPA I guess, only much better balance compared with the most session IPAs that I have had.

Bottle at S&G tasting.
APPEARANCE: clear blond beer, small unstable white head.
NOSE: hoppy, fruity, fresh, nice.
TASTE: hoppy, fruity, fresh, nice, dry.

On tap at Haand Festival. An orange colored, unclear beer with a small, white head. The aroma is of the citrusy kind, orange peel mostly, with some pale malts. Its quite bitter on the palate, with a touch pale malts. Orange peel. Its dry and medium bodied, with a high but nice carbonation level. Lasting finish. A tasteful and quenching beer. 140524

from Erzbierschof - hazy blond-yellow beer with a moderate foam left; fresh hoppy aroma of mango, star fruit and apples; light oily and moderate malt backbone; subtle carbonation; gently bitter and pretty dry, a bit short aftertaste yet fairly tasty with more fruity hoppy tones of berries and star fruits - deeply drinkable

aromas :grapefruit, citrus notespale, golden, almost clear, long lasting white foam, light sweetness, medium bitterness, light body, bitter, 

easy drinkable beer

On tap at Craft & Draft, Amsterdam on 20th March 2015. Crystal clear gold with lasting off-white foam and scant lacing. Strong malt and intense grassy hoppiness in aroma. Tangy citrus and fresh grass in-mouth. Citrus finish with fruity berries and grassiness. Zingy mouthfeel and light body.

On tap at Craft & Draft. Clear pale gold pour thin white head. Aroma is lightly hoppy, nice grapefruit pine notes, cascade/simcoe if I had to guess. Taste is bitter, very light maltiness, quite dry. Palate is light, good carbonation pretty easy drinking.

Draft at Craft and Draft, Amsterdam. Pours clear golden with a white head. Aroma of citrus and fruity hops, light orange. Flavor is light sweet and moderate bitter. Light bodied with soft carbonation.
Poured a lightly hazy light amber with an off white head. Aroma of moderately sweet citrus and soft malt. Medium body, flavour is moderately sweet orange with a lightly bitter finish.
Ultra rafraichissante, ultra simple, propre, pure, fraiche. absolument parfaite pour les chaudes journée dété.

Golden ale di grandissima bevibilità si presenta giallo paglierino con una bella schiuma. Al naso note fruttate dove spicca molto luva ed anche sentori citrici. In bocca il corpo mediamente esile esalta la dolcezza fruttata già anticipata dall olfatto con una chiusura perfettamente amara! Buona buona!!!!
75 cl bottle. Hazy orange colour with off-white head. Aroma of citrus and grass, grapefruit. Dry hoppy, refreshing

On tap @ Haandfest 2014. This is a dishwasher colored one, pale and slightly hay colored. Small withe lacing islandy head. Nice hoppy citrus nose. Mild lemons. Some slightly sour goodness. A bit grainy in the taste. Not at all like the nice aroma. Its quite oily in the mouth and soft play prickling on the bubbles. Hay dryness, cause it is drying my mouth quite bad this. Near astringent in a way. Grassy tea like finish. This was not a favorite, but I quite liked the aroma. 24.05.2014

Il top dello stile, profumatissima, watery quanto basta, spiccatamente amara nel finale. Questa birra e arte allo stato puro.
Imperdibile per gli amanti dello stile
Vegetal, aroma dominated by Nelson Sauvin. Light yellow hazy. Small white head. Lot of lacing. A bit watery.

Gran bella beverinità per questa golden ale leggermente acidula in principio con note fruttate al naso che smorzano i profumi floreali. Buon equilibrio e ottimo corpo. 

---Rated BY Italianbeer85

Draught @ Haand Ølfestival 2014
Pours slightly hazy pale yellow with a white head. Aroma has notes of malt, citrus and orange. Taste is light sweet and light bitter with a long citrus fruity finish. Body is light, texture is thin, carbonation is soft.

24.05.2014, tap @ HaandFestival:
Nice creamy mediumlasting head. Aroma is fresh fruity, leafs, fresh hops, dried fruits, citrus, lawn, hay. Taste is slightly dry grassy, lawn, leafs, bark, hops, hints of cardboard. Medium bitterness, dry watery mouthfeel. Nice.

Gul tåkete farge med tynt hvitt skum. Lukt av humle, sitrus og sitron. Sitrus og humle i smak, nok så tynn. Kort ettersmak, lite kullsyre
Haandfesival 2014
Haandfestivalen 2014. Gul uklar, lavt skum. Malt, sitrus og litt humle i aromaen. Samme i smaken. Ganske bitter, men meget lettdrikkelig. Tynn/medium konsistens.
At moeder lambic brussels on tap. Citrusy and crisp. Good for summer drinking. Little underwhelming on flavour, but at 4.5 pc, not bad.

Nelson Souvin for president!! La birra in questione è una golden ale decisamente luppolata, con un gisto molto complesso caratterizzato da note citriche, fruttate e soprattutto di uva. Amaro intenso e apprezzabile soprattuto nel finale.
Bottle from Cotteridge Wines: clear straw yellow pour with soapy white head, citrus aroma, honey, marzipan, very light and crisp tasting.

Bottled 0,75L. Clear amber color, optimal bubbly aspect with a creamy head of long duration. Very fresh and complex aroma, notes of citrus, aged white grapes, hoppy, yeast. Very pleasant bubbly mouth, lively and crisp perception, very yeasty and hoppy final. Excellent golden ale.
On tap @All In Beer Fest 2013. Clear golden with white head. Aroma of lemon, lemon peel, flowers and hay. Taste is light; sweet, grass and lemon.
Pours a golden color with a longlasting white head. Has a fruity malty hoppy aroma with yeasty hints. Fruity malty dry hoppy bitter flavor. Has a fruity malty dry hoppy bitter finish.

Draught at All in beer festival 2013, cons 2013-11-01 Göteborg
AR: boiled fruit, citrus marmelade, dry
AP: hazy copper, frothy steady head
F: citrus, mango, lychee, lemon/grape marmelade

Draft at WLL Zwanze day event. Pours pale yellow with fluffy head. Soft initial nose with some bitters in initial taste...tasty

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Nice golden light saison with great head and lacing. Hay fever flavour with hint of sweetness in malt. Soft carbonation. Very light sour finish with some musk. On tap in impromptu sampler served up by Chris at Ebenezer Kezars.
Draft. Amber beer with a cream head. Big sauvignon blanc aroma. Big white wine flavor with light earthiness. Medium bodied. White wine and light earth lingers with light malt.

Bottle @ døe sommer fest. Cloudy pale yellow, small white head, some lacing. Aroma, malty, hoppy, tropical fruits, orange, . Taste, malty, hoppy bitter, fruity, . Bitter aftertaste. It was an old bottle but still very enjoyable.

Birra luppolata, fresca e gustosa! Molto buona ed ottima nel contesto delle artigianali!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Cask gravity at Gbbf 2013. Golden hoppy. Really hoppy. Lovely beer. Excellent. Really lovely.
Draft. Medium white head atop hazy straw body. Aroma is medium sweet, grape, some bread, grapefruit. Taste is medium sweet, grape, some orange, bread. Soft light body, easy drinking.

4oz sample at Churchkeys 3 Stars 1st Anniversary event. Pours a clear gold with some cloudy, white head. Bright scallion nose, chive, lemon, floral, straw. Flavor is sweet, hay, scallion, grassy, onion shoot, lemon. Zesty finish. Nice and refreshing.

Bottle @ Home. Pours golden with a white head. Aroma of malt, fruity hops, flowers, light citrus. Flavor is malt, light yeast, fruity hops, citrus, pine. Medium body, soft carbonation, rather bitter finish. 310713

Tap @ Mikkeller, Stefansgade. Clear golden with a white head. Aroma is sweet, malty and rather hoppy - flowers and fruit. Flavor is medium sweet and moderate bitter. Dry and moderate bitter finish. 220713
Tap @ Moeder lambic. Nice head with excellent duration. Color is golden. Aroma and taste are rich hops, flowers, citrus, malt and pine.
On tap at Moeder Lambic Fontainas. Yellowish with a big eggwhite-like head. In your face hoppiness, passion fruit and grapefruit. Good hop bitterness. Why compromise?

UPDATED: APR 18, 2016 Di color biondo pallido, nebulosa e schiumosa, agrumata e luppolata al naso, fresca e invitante; gusto amaro, delicatamente fruttato e con un retrogusto secco e asciutto. Corpo lieve, effervescenza nella norma; non complessissima ma è molto dissetante, specie quando è fresca.

From Hophead.DK.
Bottled, 250413.
Amber with white head. Aroma of spices. Flavour with fruit and malt and hops.
Golden colour. Floral piney hop aroma. Light bodied, taste of pine hops and bitterness

Tap @ Moeder Lambic Fontainas. Cheers to monsiuer Scopey for the pour. The appearance is deep gold with a small head. Light lemon sherbet citrus op nose. Honeyed bread and summery grass. The taste is light pee, citrus, some moldy woody hops. Nice and fresh.  A touch grainy. Light body, soft carbonation. Decent stuff.

Tap at Moeder Fontainas. It pours clear golden with a thick white head. The nose is pine, floral, white grape, underlying sweetness and light herbal notes. The taste is straw, assertive bitterness, touch of pithy citrus, floral and herbs, with a dry, bitter finish. Medium body and moderate carbonation. Decent hippy pale ale.

Provata alla pompa!
Chiarissima,
Quasi trasparente, schiuma pochissima.
Incredibilmente beverina, amarezza fantastica!
Ottima

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle, shared by esp0r december 1st 2012. Copper hazy body, nice white head. Aroma of grapefruit and peach, quite hoppy, with mild caramel. Crisp malty taste with a toned down hop presence. Good bitterness, bittersweet aftertaste.
Espectacular cerveza rubia transparente y ligera. Puro lúpulo, cítrica y fondo amargo. Muy bien equilibrado el cuerpo con el gas y el alcohol. Impresionante el sabor con sólo 4,3% de alcohol.
at Moeder Lambic, big bitterness for a blonde, medicinal hops, mentholyptic herbalness. Medium mouthfeel. Another impressive beer from Toccalmatto

Pours a hazy pale yellow with a nice white head. Smell is citrus, tropical fruit, nice tart nose.  Taste is bright citrus, tropical fruit which ends earthy, bitter and dry. Light body, nice carbonation of an average level. Overall a nice interpretation of a West Coast.
Blond, hoppy ale. Very good aromas, nice taste (a bit thin and watery). Very refreshing and nice.

RBBWG12
pours yellow, no foam, smells nice, hoppy
very light mouthfeel, some bitterness. OK beer !

Just like the bottle, it has summer written all over. Strong aroma of citrus (Lemon Melissa?), perhaps a bit to one-sided. low alcohol%, easy to drink. Bitter taste. Would like to try it in july outside a Roman pub.

Draft Ölrepubliken under Toccalmatto vecka. Väldigt humlig men även syrlig, god Italienare

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Pours clear pale yellow with a nice white head leaving lacing. Aroma is piny clean fruity slightly malty grapefruit cat piss. Flavor is bitter fruity astringent piny resiny and grapefruit. Finishes longlived bitter.

Draught at Ölrepubliken, Göteborg. Pale golden beer with a nice lasting offwhite head. Fruity citrus aroma, grapes, pineapples, floral notes, pears, grassy, metal notes. Hoppy fruity floral flavor, grassy, caramel, hoppy bitter, herbal and spicy notes, grapes, pears, some pepper.

Draught at Ölrepubliken during the tap takeover, on January 21, 2013.Hazy pale golden color, white head. Fruity, hoppy, red berries, sort of sweet, bitter taste. Lingering fruity bitterness. Medium to spritzy mouthfeel. Light, fruity, hoppy scent. Medium bitterness.
Bottle. Hazy yellow color, fluffy white head with good retention and solid lacing. Aroma of bright citrus. Taste is bitter lemon lime. Very tasty.

Sampled from bottle @ RBBWG 2013. Hazy a bit pale yellow color, just a small white head. Smell a lot of hops, malts. Taste malts, hops, pretty fresh, medium bitter. A bit thin bodied, medium carbonation.

Bottle at home.
Hazy yellow coloured with a medium sized white head.
Fruity aroma of citrus peel and hops with notes of pine needles.
Fruity flavour of hops, citrus peel, basil and grapefruits.
Dry hoppy finish.
Bottle, 4.3%. Slightly hazy amber with big off-white head. Aroma is malt, fruit, hop and a little citrus. Flavour is malt, fruit, hop, little citrus, medium bitter, yeast, pine and a little sweet.

05/12 On tap @Animal, Madrid, shared with teddybeer. 4.2% ABV. It poured hazy golden body with medium sized head. Nice grapefruit hop aroma with fine biscuit pale malt. Flavor was moderately bitter, spicy, citrus hops rounded with pale malts, especially bread and biscuit. Medium bodied. Pleasant, long bitter hop finish. A nice beer, almost an IPA.

Big offwhite head.  Hazy yellow body with strong carbonation.
Strong orangey tropical fruit aroma with resiny notes.  Dry
orangey resiny taste with mealy notes.  Mid-bodied.  Mild, soft
mouthfeel.  Dryish mealy resiny peachy aftertaste with orangey
funky pineapple notes.  Nice, drinkable, quite good.  (0.75l
bottle, Meny Oslo City.)

Bottle from Meny Oslo City shared at dajes place¨
Pours golden hazy with a frothy head. Smells of citrus, mango and malts. Moderate sweet, quite fruity, alot of tropical fruits in here. Medium bitter, orange zests and some resins. A quite nice beer, low abv makes this 0,75L bottle a beer for one person :) Quite sessionable

On tap @ Animal. Shared with Heavy. Pale golden colour with a white head, medium lasting and good lacing. Aroma is light, medium malty, with citrus and grapefruit notes. Flavor is moderate bittery, fresh and citrusy. The bittery is more present in the flavor than in Aroma. Also some floral hops are present. Lightly dry final maintaining the initial bitterness. Carbonation and body are medium.

Sampled from a 0.75 L bottle. Stable white head. Body is hazed, straw yellow. Inviting hop aroma; Mixed bag tropical, reminiscent of tangerines pineapple, passionfruit and dried apricot. Notes of mild spices and light toasted malts. Easy on the palate. Not very full, yet tasty. Distinct bitterness. Mild fruity hop flavors, backed by a lightly sweet malt body. Bitterness linger in the ending. Moreish.

Tasted on tap @BQ, Milano, in July 2012.
Aroma - mostly citrus, pineapple and pines somewhere far away.
Taste is some mix of a watery lager and  a mediocre ipa, nothing special, but quite drinkable during summer.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottled. Pours hazy amber with a medium sized off-white head. Nose of caramel, citrus and flowerish hops. Sweet flavor that ends up more dry and decent bittr. Medium bodied, oily texture and soft CO2. ★★★★

UPDATED: SEP 29, 2015 Color: hazy blond beer with small carbonation, yeast and small white head. Smell: hops and wheat. Taste: hops, malt, wheat and yeast. Aftertaste: nice bitterness and fresh sensation.

On bottle from Meny Oslo City.
Golden color , good foam.
Good fruit, quite intense hops , some catpiss 
Medium/ light body & medium complexity.
Good bitterness & balance .
Enjoyable

Draft at Moeder Lambic in St-Gilles. Orange-amber with a fluffy off-white head. Hoppy-fruity nose with loads of orange zest, unripe grapefruit notes. Dryish and mildly bitter, going for straight fruity hop flavor. Easy-going and refreshing pale ale that hits several of my sweet spots.

75cl bottle from Meny, Oslo City. Pours slightly hazy golden with a white head. Hoppy aroma with lots of citrus (grapefruit), some tropical fruits and pale malt. Pretty light body with full flavour. Lightly sweet and quite fruity with a nice, citrussy bitterness in the dry finish. Pleasant and refreshing! (2012-10-27)

Shared bottle, courtesy of Håndverkerstuene. Pale golden body with a big white head. Nice aroma, light malty, fruity yeast, hint of thyme, oregano and pepper. Flavor is light and very refreshing, soft, light malt, sweet, fruity and spicy. Low bitterness. Medium body and moderate on aftertaste. A light and refreshing beer that grows, could easily have a few of this one.
Intense herbal and citrus aroma, exotic fruit like grapefruit. Taste is medium bitter and drinkable.
Sample at Håndverkerstuene. Golden colour with a white head. Aroma is citrus, hop, spices. Flavour is dust, hop, pine , spices, herbs, yeast. Nice beer.

(Draught at Chez Moeder Lambic Saint-Gilles, Brussels, 18 July 2012) Pale amber colour, slightly hazy, with frothy off-white head. Fruity, malty nose with citrus, apricots and fresh hops. Malty, fruity taste with notes of citrus, apricots, grainy malt and slightly resinous hops in a finish with a generous bitterness. Medium body, with a slight sweetness. Nice and tasty.

Clear blond colour, white head. Hoppy aroma, fruity citrus, grapefruit, passion fruit, apricot, malts and caramel. Light malty, quite bitter flavour. Quite light body, bitter finish with malty touches.
Very enjoyable, and really nice for a relatively light ABV beer.
(Draught @ Moeder Lambic, Italian Beer Festival. Thanks for sharing, tderoeck!)
Bottle. Pours a golden color with a longlasting white head. Has a fruity malty hoppy aroma with yeasty hints. Fruity malty dry hoppy bitter flavor. Has a fruity malty dry hoppy bitter finish.

Clear golden pour. Big white head. Frothy. Plenty of lacing. Hoppy, fruity, yeasty aroma. Citrus notes and some grass notes. Bitter, citrusy bite up front. Malty and dry. Sweet with a nice earthy note. Not bad.

3/VI/2012 - on tap @ Moeder Lambic, Italian Beer Festival (2012-590) 
Clear orange beer, big frothy white head, little adhesive. Aroma: very fruity, citrus, grapefruits, peaches, touch of exotic fruits. MF: good carbon, medium body. Taste: very bitter, dry hops, bit piny, citrus fruits, grapefruit, lemon zest. Much less fruitier than what you would expect. Aftertaste: very bitter hops, citrus, grapefruit, medicinal bitter and dry ending.

Bottle from Dranken Geers, Oostakker, Gent, Belgium 26th May 2012 consumed at Garmisch Zugspitz campsite in Frank the camper Mon 28th May 2012.  Pours gold, crystal clear with white head. Touch of soapy hops at first, then smooth with an almost creamy texture, in fact amazingly soft in the mouth. I get a light grapefruit flavour but this is a very easy drinking beer, yes it is fruity and a decent drop but above all one of its greatest accomplishments is coming in under 5%.   A6 A5 T7 P3 Ov14  3.5
On tap at Moeder Lambic. Nice amber body with puffy head. Nose is hops and fruits. Taste also hoppy, pine and lots of sweet fruits in there. Nice malty notes. Warm in the finish. Good one.

25 cl. draft @ Chez Moeder Lambic Fontainas // Italian Beer Festival // apricot amber with a white head // smell is quite fruity, very fruity hops, caramel, exotic fruits, grapefruit (sweeter side), passion fruit, mango, yeast // taste contains the same elements, yeast, fruity hops, exotic fruits, passion fruit, mango, yeast if quite fruity & definite caramel & flowers, touch bitter than the smell, going towards a more bitter finish with hints of floral // lightly oily, caramel malts, softer carb. body, quite nice, could have been upped a touch to amazing but for the ABV this is doing greatly

Draft @ Moeder Lambic Italian Beer Festival 12.
Orangée, col épais blanc.
Arôme est très fleuri offrant un bouquet très agréable, le tout oscillant vers des notes de feuilles de thé vert.
En bouche, léger houblonné avec une brève douceur de grains. Garde ce profile Toccalmatto, le palais est sec fin de bouche allant vers lherbacé et houblon fleuri. Pointe de malt grillé le tout prenant un aspect plus IPA et les 4.3% restent léger paraissant plus, facile à boire.
Bottle. Color hazy gold with big white head. Aroma citrus, flowers, caramel, yeast. Taste sweet, hoppy, bitter, citrus.

Golden body with white headAroma of citrus and flowers, as also caramel and yeast. Bittersweet taste. Body slightly to moderate, moderate carbonation and a pleasant dry aftertaste. A pleasant surprise

Pensavo meglio, cioe me laspettavo diversa! Cmq pur non apprezzando molto le ale inglesi direi che questa e buona! Sopratutto si presenta molto bene e lascia un ottimo retrogusto fruttato ed erbaceo davvero molto prolungato!
cereal, floral, herbs, golden, light sweetness, medium bitterness, medium body, soft carbonation

Draft at BQ. Pours a clear copperish color with a thin bubbly white head. Aroma is herbal and fruity, definitely hoppy. Flavor is light and does not really stand up to the expectations: some grassy and citric notes, lightly fruity, but nothing stands really out. Light carbonation and light/medium bodied. Overall, quite simple and refreshing brew.
Una golden con luppoli americani, lavrei preferita certamente con un amaro diverso.
Golden body, white head. Aroma of some hops, not as groovy as advertised. Flavour has malt, some dryness, little hop bitterness in aftertaste. Quite poor.

Good white head over copper-golden beer. Superb hoppy nose, fruity & citrussy, grapefruit & passionfruit. Very citric hopsflavour, pineapple, some faint pale malts as backing - not light. Mandarinepeel warming up. Of course its light, and sparkling. But nobody could ever complain about lack of taste, here. Groovy indeed!
Light hops, nice aroma, but the taste is not so strong and bitter as i think. i prefer other toccalmatto beers
Bottled. Hazy golden color, short head. Aroma of hop, tropical fruit, bit flowery, nelson sauvin hops. Bit sweet, slightly sour taste, tropical fruit, soft bitter. Decent brew.

Draft. An unclear amber beer with a lazing orangey head. The aroma has strong notes grass and grapefruit as well as medium notes of malt. The flavor is sweet with notes of malt, caramel, and grapefruit as well as light notes of  phenol, leading to a dry bitter finish. The body is light.
From tap at Domus Birrae. Pours hazy orange with a small white head. Aroma is peachy and citrusy. Crisp hops fruity and bitter flavoured. Nice lemony and peachy. Crisp bitter and clean finish.

On tap. RBESG Rome 2010. Pours a cloudy and opaque amber with an off-white head. Fresh citrusy hop aroma. Medium body, a dry fruitiness and a fresh citrusy hoppiness that doesnt leave a massive bitterness. Quite fresh. 050610

On tap at Ma Che Siete Venuti a Fa and in Domus Birrae. Cloudy golden with a fluffy and lasting white head. Clean hoppy aroma of citrus, peach, other tropical fruits and pine. Resinous hop flavour on a full bodied, but subdued malt background. Pine and tropical fruits. Bitter finish. A stunning session beer.

On tap at Ma Che Siete. Hazy golden with a medium white head. The aroma is fruity hopps, citrus and caramel. Light pine, citrus, peach, passion fruit and caramel in the flavour. Long bitter finish. Refreshing.

June 5th 2010. On tap at Domus Birrae. Cloudy amber beer. Little white head. Crisp fresh palate. A fresh water interlude before some light malt and lighter hops kick in. Pretty fresh and crisp and very lightweight. A perfect hot day beer if a bit dry.
Un peletto ossidata che ne dite voi che lo sapete e che eravate con me eheh fusti vecchi?
Bevuta a Pasturana; molto molto buona, questa golden ale ha un intenso profumo di pompelmo che si ritrova anche in bocca.

Tap @ Ma Che Siete and Domus Birrae, Rome. This is for the Ma Che Siete which was the best experience. Pours unclear yellow with a small creamy white head and lacings. Nose is cat piss, fresh, crisp and very hoppy. Clean - very clean for an italian beer. Blackurrant and grape. Fresh and dry. Dope

Draught at Football Pub. Clear yellow - white head.  
Fruity. Peppery. Light bitterness. Freshness. Light zesty. Light malty. Very fresh. Nice.

On tap at Domus Birrae, RBESG Rome day 3. Light hazy yellow colour, white head. Aroma of light fruits, lemon, light malty, flowery. Flavour is light sweet, lemony, flowery, hint of cardboard in the light hoppy finish. Light bodied. Nah.
tap at domus birrae . bir and fud shop 2 .... hazy lemon yellow ... light white head ... soft lemon nose ... soft wheat hop ... very light lemon .nice refreshing

Draught at Ma Che Siete Venuti a Fà, Rome. Murky golden with a creamy laced head. Notes of lychee, passionfruit and pineapple. Flavour is biscuity malt, caramel and tropical fruit. Surprisingly a touch thin in mouthfeel. Short soapy finish. Some flawed character showing through.

Colore tendente al rosso, con una opacità abbastanza pronunciata. Laroma e fruttato, con note citriche. Ha un sapore molto luppolato, secco. Retrogusto amarognolo e bevibilità altissima.... attenzione! www.birrarium.com

Bottle 750ml.Light unclear medium orange color with a small to average, frothy, good lacing, mostly diminishing, off-white to white head. Aroma is moderate malty, toasted, caramel, fruity, moderate to light light heavy hoppy, flowers, light citrus - orange, light yeasty, apricot notes. Flavor is moderate to light light heavy sweet and bitter with a average to long duration. Body is medium, texture is oily, carbonation is soft. [20091110]

Cloudy light amber color. The aroma is hoppy, fruity, with grapefruits and grapes, leaning on the grassy side, lightly flowery and honeish too. Dry mouthfeel; the strong hopping hides some good malt, lightly crispy, never sweet; the hop is resiny and partially fruity, leading to a long final. More stylish than the Beer Here Fat Cat, cleaner than the Revelation Cat. Well balanced and excellent.

Draught at BQ, Milan.  Cloudy golden, small head. Aroma of grass and canteloupe. Quite dry with light-medium body. Fairly soft with carmally malt back bone. The hops come out more as bitterness than aroma.
